intro: Trigonochilum crassopterum, commonly known as the broad-winged orchid, is a terrestrial orchid species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, broad, leathery leaves and its showy, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its flowers have a unique structure with three broad, spreading petals and a prominent, spurred lip. Trigonochilum crassopterum is a rare and protected species, often found in specific ecological niches that support its growth.
